decks.notes: This Jund Control deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and controlling the board. The key concept revolves around using cards like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King, Woe Strider, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to generate card advantage and drain your opponent's life. The deck utilizes engine cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven to create a loop of sacrificing and recurring creatures. Mayhem Devil adds additional damage whenever you sacrifice a permanent. The deck also includes Bolas's Citadel for extra card advantage and Claim the Firstborn to take control of key creatures from your opponent.

The deck focuses on using Wilderness Reclamation to generate mana advantage, while controlling the opponent's spells with counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute. It also ramps up with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and can create a massive amount of card advantage using Expansion / Explosion. Shark Typhoon provides a win condition while Aether Gust helps deal with problematic threats. The deck aims to outlast opponents through control and card advantage, using the Temur colors for flexibility and power.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while disrupting the opponent's strategy with counters like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust. Elspeth Conquers Death provides removal and recursion, while Shark Typhoon can create threats to close out the game. The deck's strength lies in its ability to out-value opponents and maintain control of the game until it can win with powerful finishers like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis.

The deck focuses on establishing control over the game through a combination of card advantage, removal, and powerful threats. Using cards like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and maintain control of the battlefield. Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils help disrupt opponents' game plans while cards like Casualties of War and Extinction Event provide answers to threats on the board. With a mix of ramp, card draw, and powerful finishers, the deck aims to grind out victories and overpower opponents in the late game.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the flow of the game by using sacrifice effects and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Witch's Oven, and Mayhem Devil, the deck can generate value by sacrificing creatures and dealing damage to the opponent. The addition of Woe Strider and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King helps to further fuel this engine. Bolas's Citadel provides a powerful finisher while cards like Claim the Firstborn and Vraska, Golgari Queen offer additional control elements. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing a variety of disruptive creatures and removal spells to slow down the opponent's game plan. The key strategy revolves around maximizing value from Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, allowing for additional triggers of enter-the-battlefield effects from creatures like Yarok's Fenlurker and Charming Prince. The deck also includes cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support the Orzhov color combination and ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of sacrifice synergies, using cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Mayhem Devil to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent. The strategy revolves around creating a loop of sacrificing creatures with Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven, gaining advantage with the card advantage from Castle Locthwain, and finishing off the opponent quickly with powerful threats like Rotting Regisaur and Dreadhorde Butcher. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional flexibility and resources to support the aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counter spells and removal, while also generating card advantage and ramping with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through the use of Aether Gust, Negate, and Mystical Dispute. It can then win the game by either overwhelming the opponent with card draw and large Shark Typhoons or by using Expansion / Explosion as a finisher. The deck also has a versatile manabase to ensure consistent access to its many colors.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes powerful control cards like Mystical Dispute, Negate, Aether Gust, and Expansion / Explosion to handle threats and protect key cards. Wilderness Reclamation is used to generate mana advantage, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card draw and life gain. Shark Typhoon and Brazen Borrower offer versatility and a win condition in the form of a flying army or tempo plays. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by using counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi. It generates card advantage through interactive spells like Shark Typhoon and Growth Spiral, while also ramping with Uro and Nissa. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by countering key spells with cards like Mystical Dispute and Aether Gust. The mana base allows flexibility in casting spells from multiple colors, ensuring consistency in controlling the game's tempo and board state.

The main strategy of this Bant Control deck is to control the board with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to stall the game until it can resolve powerful threats like Shark Typhoon and Elspeth Conquers Death. With Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils disrupting opponents' plays, the deck looks to establish a dominant board presence with planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The mana base is built to consistently cast the deck's powerful spells and ensure efficient color fixing.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through sacrificing creatures and generating value from them. By using cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven, the deck can generate a lot of value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Korvold, Fae-Cursed King acts as a powerful win condition while also providing card draw. The deck also has some ramp elements with Gilded Goose and Bolas's Citadel to help accelerate its game plan. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent with its value generating engines and control elements.

The focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using powerful removal spells and disruptive creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With Yorion as the companion, the player has access to additional cards and can take advantage of the enter-the-battlefield effects of multiple creatures. The deck also includes card draw and lifegain engines to maintain card advantage and survive in the late game. Overall, the Orzhov Control deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through incremental advantage.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence through aggressive creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Spawn of Mayhem, while also utilizing powerful equipment like Embercleave to finish off opponents quickly. The deck also includes disruption cards like Drill Bit to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep the pressure on. With a mix of efficient creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game using counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral. The deck aims to generate card advantage with cards like Chemister's Insight and Expansion / Explosion, as well as create threats with Shark Typhoon and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Aether Gust to deal with a variety of threats.Using these tools, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through card advantage and efficient answers.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice mechanics and dealing direct damage to quickly overwhelm opponents. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Witch's Oven to repeatedly sacrifice creatures and generate additional value. This allows for continuous triggering of abilities like Mayhem Devil's direct damage and Dreadhorde Butcher's growing power. The deck also includes cards like Rotting Regisaur and Robber of the Rich to apply constant pressure on the opponent's life total. Overall, the deck aims to quickly swarm the board with aggressive creatures and utilize sacrifice mechanics for advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. It also looks to stabilize the game with powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is configured to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to all necessary resources.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing card advantage, disruption, and removal spells to slow down the opponent's strategy while ramping into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck features a mix of counterspells and removal like Aether Gust and Shatter the Sky to deal with threats, as well as planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to generate value and create advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while controlling the game and ultimately winning through card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells and disrupting the opponent's strategy using cards like Negate, Dovin's Veto, and Aether Gust. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to bounce problematic permanents and prevent opponents from casting spells at instant speed. The deck also ramps up with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath while generating threats like Shark Typhoon, Nightpack Ambusher, and Brazen Borrower. The mana base is carefully constructed to support multiple colors and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and enchantments while utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for added value by blinking permanents. The deck has a mix of removal, counterspells, and card draw to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent. The goal is to stall the game until the late game where the deck can overpower the opponent through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. The mana base is designed to support the deck's Esper colors and ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The main strategy of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Rotting Regisaur, while using powerful equipment like Embercleave and Shadowspear to push through damage and finish off opponents quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Heartless Act to control the board, as well as card draw and life loss from cards like Stormfist Crusader. The mana base is built to support a fast and consistent aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and basic lands.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and card advantage while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The deck aims to efficiently deal with threats on the board, generate card advantage, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful late-game spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon. The deck also has a strong land base to support its three-color mana requirements and has a versatile sideboard to handle different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Aether Gust. It also aims to gain value and card advantage with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, while also having the flexibility to create threats with Shark Typhoon. The deck prioritizes ramping up mana with Growth Spiral and lands like Fabled Passage to cast its high-impact spells and dominate the board.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to control the game and generate advantage. The deck also includes efficient counterspells and removal spells to deal with threats, along with powerful card draw engines like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors needed for spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on, ramp into powerful threats, and finish the game with a big swing using cards like Shark Typhoon or Finale of Glory.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers and creatures to control the game by managing opponents' threats and generating card advantage. It aims to use cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to disrupt opponents' strategies while building up resources with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. Removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death help maintain board control, while the deck's mana base provides flexibility in casting its powerful spells. The strategy revolves around incremental advantage and resource management to outlast opponents.

This Bant Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers and efficient removal spells to control the board and outvalue opponents. With a mix of card advantage engines like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, alongside versatile cards like Shark Typhoon and Aether Gust, the deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant position with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Teferi, Time Raveler. By controlling the board state and generating constant value, the deck aims to grind out opponents and secure victory in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, along with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Hydroid Krasis and Shark Typhoon. Additionally, counterspells like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute help to protect against opposing threats, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to maintain a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle by utilizing efficient creatures with strong abilities like haste, trample, and protection. By constantly applying pressure on the opponent early in the game, the deck aims to overwhelm them with a combination of powerful creatures and impactful combat tricks. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provides additional ways to finish off the opponent quickly and efficiently.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures with high power and toughness for their mana cost. By playing efficient and powerful creatures like Barkhide Troll and Questing Beast, backed up by combat tricks like Giant Growth and Titanic Growth, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. With a low mana curve and a mono-green mana base, this deck seeks to consistently apply pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, efficient creatures and fast-paced aggression. By utilizing a combination of strong, resilient creatures like Gemrazer and Questing Beast, along with support cards like Ram Through and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Yorvo, Lord of Garenbrig and Pelt Collector further enhances the deck's ability to quickly grow and strengthen its creatures, making it a formidable force in the early to mid game.

The deck focuses on using a mix of discard, removal, and creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects to control the game and outvalue opponents. By utilizing Yorion as a companion, the player can consistently flicker their permanents, gaining additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Agonizing Remorse and Basilica Bell-Haunt, while gradually gaining advantage with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Doom Foretold. The mana base is focused on providing the necessary colors for the deck's spells and abilities.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by consistently playing low-cost creatures and using powerful cards like Embercleave to quickly close out the game. It utilizes strong creatures like Spawn of Mayhem and Knight of the Ebon Legion to pressure opponents, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Drill Bit. The mana base is optimized for quick access to all colors needed for the deck, with a mix of fast lands and utility lands like Fabled Passage and Castle Locthwain.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures with low mana costs and powerful abilities, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient damage output. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Shadowspear further boosts the deck's aggression and allows for powerful combat tricks. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive nature of the deck, with a mix of Mountains and Swamps alongside dual lands like Blood Crypt and Tournament Grounds. Overall, the key strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells while maintaining a steady flow of cards through card draw effects. The deck aims to efficiently utilize the aggressive power of Rakdos creatures like Rotting Regisaur and Knight of the Ebon Legion, supported by strong removal like Bonecrusher Giant and Heartless Act. The inclusion of Embercleave as a finisher allows for powerful swings in the late game to close out matches. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on efficiently deploying aggressive creatures with powerful abilities to apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Fervent Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Spawn of Mayhem, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck's removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Blacklance Paragon can help clear the way for big attacks. The inclusion of Embercleave provides a powerful finisher to close out games. With a mix of creatures, removal, and combat tricks, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of card advantage, removal spells, and powerful threats to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By ramping into powerful creatures like Uro and Hydroid Krasis, along with planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Nissa, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Agonizing Remorse and Extinction Event. The deck also includes versatile spells like Aether Gust and Thought Distortion to deal with a variety of threats, making it a resilient and adaptable control deck.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, the deck aims to generate value and create threats while maintaining control of the board. Wilderness Reclamation enables the player to untap lands and generate massive amounts of mana, allowing for big plays with cards like Expansion / Explosion. The deck also includes cards like Aether Gust to deal with problematic permanents and maintain tempo in the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, card advantage, and powerful threats. Utilizing cards like Dovin's Veto and Mystical Dispute to counter opponent's spells, while generating card advantage with Growth Spiral and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon, while generating mana advantage with Wilderness Reclamation and powerful finishers like Expansion / Explosion. With a balanced mana base and strong control elements, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their creatures, and generating card advantage. It aims to ramp up mana quickly with Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, allowing for big spells like Expansion / Explosion and Shark Typhoon to take over the game. The deck has a solid mana base with access to multiple colors, providing flexibility in handling various threats. The key strategy is to maintain control of the board while generating value and closing out the game with powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to dominate the battlefield. It also includes key spells like Aether Gust and Mystical Dispute to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, allowing for the early deployment of impactful threats like Hydroid Krasis. The inclusion of versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Elspeth Conquers Death provide additional flexibility and removal options to maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to generate card advantage and mana advantage through cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation, allowing the player to have more resources at their disposal. It also includes threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to apply pressure and close out the game. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game and outlasting the opponent through efficient spellcasting and strategic decision-making.
